item.title: The Secret Lives of Country Gentlemen
item.description: Update: Yep. [[books/a noblemans guide to seducing a scoundrel|Second book]] delivers the very necessary half of the whole. I adored it, and now I adore this one on re-read.

item.title: Glitterland
item.description: Give me any book where the hero is not conventional hero material, and is devalued by the world, and is the best person in the world anyway, and is unashamed to be themselves, and makes molehills out of mountains because they love freely and completely.

item.title: The Sorcerer of the Wildeeps
item.description: Whoa. Masterful use of dialect and structure to deconstruct the traditional bounds of genre and narrative. The way the characters code-switch their way through multiple registers and languages—well-known and invented—is reflected in the way the novella flips through genres like a catalog, exposing the expectations and limitations of each.

item.title: Liberty & Other Stories
item.description: I did not think I could love the [[series/prosperityverse|Prosperityverse]] more, BUT I DO.
